cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as a group of concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. Then the Outer Planes form another wheel around that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all. The Positive and Negative Planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

alternateConfigurations.name: World Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively)

alternateConfigurations.name: Astral Above Elemental Below
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane; an Overheaven for good deities and Celestials; and an Underworld for evil deities and Fiends

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Negative Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: The source of necrotic energy that destroys the living and animates the Undead. A needy, greedy plane, sucking the life out of anything that is vulnerable. Heat, fire, and life itself are all drawn into the maw of this plane, which always hungers for more.
planes.emotionalInfluence: The Negative Plane has all the apathy and despair of Hades and the Shadowfell, combined and concentrated in an infinite expanse of nonbeing and uncreation. The experience tends to drain all the vitality, energy, and happiness from body and soul.

physicalProperties.shape: Cupped like a bowl beneath the other planes; a lightless void without end, an eternal pit
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: A dark, empty void. No natural light exists. The plane is a lightless void without end. Heat, fire, and life itself are drawn into the plane.

temperature.description: No specific temperature given; heat is drawn into the plane, suggesting extreme cold or absence of thermal energy.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: None described; the plane is a featureless void.

timeFlow.description: No specific time flow alteration is described for the Negative Plane.

hazards.name: Life-Draining Environment
hazards.description: Merely entering the Negative Plane is comparable to the life-draining touch of a wraith. The plane is the source of necrotic energy that destroys the living. It sucks the life out of anything that is vulnerable. Only creatures that have Immunity to Necrotic damage can survive there for long.

hazards.name: Voidstones
hazards.description: In some locations on the Negative Plane, the intensity of the plane is so great that the negative energy folds in on itself, stabilizing into solid chunks of matter that devour light. These chunks, called voidstones, are thought to be the source of Spheres of Annihilation and similar magical effects. Anything that comes into contact with a voidstone is destroyed in seconds.

environmentalEffects.name: Necrotic Annihilation
environmentalEffects.description: The Negative Plane is the source of necrotic energy that destroys the living and animates the Undead. Merely entering the plane is comparable to the life-draining touch of a wraith. Only creatures that have Immunity to Necrotic damage can survive there for long.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Only creatures with Immunity to Necrotic damage can survive on the Negative Plane for long. Entering the plane subjects vulnerable creatures to effects comparable to a wraith's life-draining touch.
environmentalEffects.emotionalEffect: The experience tends to drain all the vitality, energy, and happiness from body and soul. The plane has all the apathy and despair of Hades and the Shadowfell, combined and concentrated.

environmentalEffects.name: Light Absorption
environmentalEffects.description: The Negative Plane is a lightless void without end. To an observer, there is little to see. It is a dark, empty place where the plane steals away all light and life. Voidstones devour light.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: No natural light exists on the plane. The plane actively draws in and extinguishes light. Voidstones devour light in their vicinity.

dayNightCycle.description: No day/night cycle; perpetual lightless void

specialRules.name: Necrotic Immunity Required for Survival
specialRules.description: Only creatures that have Immunity to Necrotic damage can survive on the Negative Plane for long. Merely entering the plane is comparable to the life-draining touch of a wraith, so vulnerable creatures face immediate life-draining effects.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Creatures without Immunity to Necrotic damage cannot survive on the Negative Plane for long. The plane continuously drains life from all vulnerable creatures. Entering the plane subjects creatures to effects comparable to a wraith's life-draining touch.

specialRules.name: Voidstone Destruction
specialRules.description: Voidstones are solid chunks of stabilized negative energy that devour light. They are thought to be the source of Spheres of Annihilation and similar magical effects. Anything that comes into contact with a voidstone is destroyed in seconds.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Contact with a voidstone results in total destruction of any object or creature within seconds. No saving throw or damage roll is described; the effect is instantaneous annihilation.

adventureThemes: Draining of vitality energy and happiness
Apathy and despair combined and concentrated
Survival in an inherently lethal environment
Retrieving objects or rescuing creatures from the void

planarTravelMethods.name: Gate
planarTravelMethods.description: The Gate spell can directly transport adventurers to any other plane, including the Negative Plane.
risks: Arriving in a lethal environment without Necrotic immunity

planarTravelMethods.name: Plane Shift
planarTravelMethods.description: Plane Shift can transport adventurers to the Negative Plane with varying degrees of precision.
requirements: Tuning fork attuned to the Negative Plane

savingThrowProbabilities.formula: P(fail | modifier m) = max(0.05, min(0.95, (DC - 1 - m) / 20))
